text:
A general view of the midtown Manhattan - Queensboro Bridge vicinity as photographed northeastward from the Chanin Building at Lexington Avenue and 42nd Street. The district shown is above same east of Third Avenue (lower left corner). In the right center is the partly completed Beekman Tower. To the north, at the foot of the bridge, nestles the new residential zone, Sutton Pl.

1928

Ewing Galloway
title: General view - Midtown Manhattan - Queensboro Bridge.

folder: Marie Curie Avenue & 70th Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Marie Curie Avenue (Exterior Street), south from 70th Street, showing excavating work at the right where the New York Hospital and Cornell Medical School is to be built. Farther south, on the south side of 68th Street, a new laboratory building is under construction for the Rockefeller Institute. The name Exterior Street will not be changed to Marie Curie Avenue until 1935.

August 21, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

Neg. ** 1271

A general view of midtown Manhattan as photographed northward from the Consolidated Edison Co. Bldg. Running through the left center is Irving Place and Lexington Avenue. To the right is Third Avenue. Washington Irving High School for Girls is in the center foreground. Across the top, from left to right are the outstanding Metropolitan Life, the New York Life, the No. 10 East 40th Street, the Grand Central and Chanin Bldgs. In the upper right corner Tudor City, the East River and the Queensboro Bridge.

March 27, 1929

New York Edison Company
title: General view - Midtown Manhattan from Consolidated Edison building.

General View Midtown Manhattan, East 50 s area: View 1 and 2 are northeastward across the rooftops of Mid-Manhattan's residential area in the East 50's seen from the R. C. A. Building and showing also the queensboro Bridge. In the center background of view 1 is the New York Hospital and Cornell Midical Center. On the right in view 2 is the River House.

View 3 is north along Lexington (left) and Third Avenues.

P. L. Sperr

. December 1, 1932
Views 1-3

folder: East 49th and 53rd Streets - Williamsburg and Queensborough Bridges - [United States Volunteer Life Saving Corps.], Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
East River, from East 49th (left), to East 53rd Streets, showing (facing on the water-front) the 15-story house No. 1 Beekman Place, at the N.E. corner of East 49th Street, the 15-story Campanile on the south side of East 52nd Street, and the 26-story River House, from East 52nd to East 53rd Streets. Also shown (center background, right to left) are; the General Electric Co. Building, the R.C.A. Building and the Hotel Waldorf-Astoria. The point of vantage is Welfare Island.
May 4, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, a more limited view. The vantage point is Welfare Island.
May 4, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, north from East 51st Street; and showing a portion of the Queensborough Bridge. In the foreground is visible the 1-story (white) building of the Volunteer Life Saving Co.
July 3, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.
title: East River - Shore and skyline of Manhattan between East 49th and 53rd Streets - Williamsburg and Queensborough Bridges - [United States Volunteer Life Saving Corps.]

text:
(1)
East River, south from East 59th to 53rd Streets, showing the 13-story apartment house No. 1 Sutton Place South (U-shaped), from East 57th Street to East 56th Street, and the River House (extreme left) from East 53rd to 52nd Streets. Also shown (background, right to left) are; the R.C.A. (second one), the General Electric Co. (4th), Hotel Waldorf-Astoria, New York Central (with cupola-like roof), the Lincoln and Chrysler Buildings. The vantage point is the Queensboro Bridge.

March 5, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, to East 55th Street, and showing a portion of the Queensboro Bridge and plants of the New York Steam Corporation. The point of vantage is Welfare Island.

May 4, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, at a later date. The point of vantage is Welfare Island.

Autumn 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: East 54th and 55th Streets - [Sutton Place] - Williamsburg and Queensborough Bridges., Manhattan, NY
text:
(1) East River, shoreline, north from East 54th to 55th Streets, showing a playground occupying the area between the above mentioned streets and extending west to Sutton Place (left). Also shown are; a 14-story apartment house No. 437-453 East 56th Street (left), the 13-story house No. 1 Sutton Place South, and the Queensborough Bridge (in part).

May 4, 1933.

P.L. Sperr.

(2) The same, at a later date, from a different angle (viewed in a northwesterly direction). Note the change in the appearance of the two low structures seen in view 1 (extreme right in this view) bearing Nos. 507-503 (right to left) and 501 East 55th Street.

July 10, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: East 57th Street - [Sutton Place ] - Williamsburg and Queensborough Bridges., Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
East River, south from East 57th Street, showing the 13-story apartment house No. 1 Sutton Place South; the brewery of the Consumers Brewing Co.; and the River House (center). Also shown is the skyline of Mid-town Manhattan with the Chrysler and Empire State Buildings visible in the center background. The point of vantage is the Queensborough Bridge.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, another view from the same vantage point. The Chrysler Building, here, obstructs the view of the Empire State.
March 5, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, at a later date. The vantage point is Welfare Island.
May 4, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: East River - Shore and skyline of Manhattan from East 57th Street - [Sutton Place ] - Williamsburg and Queensborough Bridges.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, at a later date. The vantage point is Welfare Island.
May 4, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: East River - Shore and skyline of Manhattan from East 57th Street - [Sutton Place ] - Williamsburg and Queensborough Bridges.

folder: East 57th Street - [Sutton Place ] - Williamsburg and Queensborough Bridges., Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
East River, south from East 57th Street, showing the 13-story apartment house No. 1 Sutton Place South; the brewery of the Consumers Brewing Co.; and the River House (center). Also shown is the skyline of Mid-town Manhattan with the Chrysler and Empire State Buildings visible in the center background. The point of vantage is the Queensborough Bridge.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, another view from the same vantage point. The Chrysler Building, here, obstructs the view of the Empire State.
March 5, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, at a later date. The vantage point is Welfare Island.
May 4, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: East River - Shore and skyline of Manhattan from East 57th Street - [Sutton Place ] - Williamsburg and Queensborough Bridges.

folder: East 60th and 63rd Streets - Williamsburg and Queensborough Bridges., Manhattan, NY
text:
East River, shoreline, north from East 60th (left) to East 63rd Streets, showing (left to right) piers 102, 103 and 104. Also shown (left to right) is a portion of Queensborough Bridge, yards of the Colonial Sand and Coal Co., and gas tanks and pumping station of the Consolidated Edison Co. In the left background are shown the Hotel Sherry-Netherland and Hotel Pierre. The vantage point is Welfare Island.
May 4, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: East River - Shore and skyline of Manhattan between East 60th and 63rd Streets - Williamsburg and Queensborough Bridges.

text:
East River, Queens shore, Long Island City, showing the waterfront area bounded approximately by 43rd Road and 44th Drive. Prominently shown in the center is a large macaroni factory. On the left is the Queensboro Bridge.

P. L. Sperr

May 4, 1933

folder: Marie Curie Avenue & 64th Street (East), Manhattan, NY
text:
Marie Curie Ave., (Ave. B.) south from about East 64th Street. Also shown across park, is the west side of York Ave., from East 60th to 64th Streets. The Flower Hospital which is shown on the right, is between East 63rd and 64th Streets. A portion of the Queensboro Bridge appears on the extreme left.

September 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: East 83rd and 97th Streets - Queensborough Bridge - [New York Edison Company.], Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
East River, New York's skyline, from East 97th (right) to East 83rd (left) Streets, showing Hell Gate (center and right) and Mill Rock (right). On the left is shown the Astoria, Queens shore abutting into the river, and across it Carl Schurz Park. The rectangular building, on the extreme right, is a storage house of the New York Edison Company, from East 95th to East 96th Streets. Also shown is the excursion boat 'Calvert' approaching the Triborough Bridge, which is the point of vantage.
July 25, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, showing a more extensive view of the river in a southerly direction, with the Queensborough Bridge in the background.
July 25, 1936.
title: East River - Shore and skyline of Manhattan between East 83rd and 97th Streets - Queensborough Bridge - [New York Edison Company.]

folder: Astoria - [Tisdale Lumber and Coal Company.], Queens, NY
text:
East River, Queens shore, Astoria, showing the neck of land which protrudes into the East River at Hell Gate and forms Pot Cove on the north and (left) Halletts Cove on the south. On the tip, where the river bends, was located old Fort Stevens. Some marble works, the Tisdale lumber and coal yards, an iron foundry, and other manufacturing plants line the shore. Also shown is Manhattan and the Queensboro bridge.

P. L. Sperr

July 25, 1936
Views 1,2,3
title: East River - Queens shore - Astoria - [Tisdale Lumber and Coal Company.]

folder: East 50th and 58th Streets - Williamsburg and Queensborough Bridges - [Campanile Apartments ; River House.], Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
East River, shoreline, north from East 50th (left) to East 58th Streets, showing prominently two structures, the 15-story Campanile and the 26-story River House; both at 52nd Street. On the extreme right appears a portion of that exclusive residential area, known as Sutton Place.

P. L. Sperr

(2)
A similar view from East 49th Street dock. Note to the right the thoroughfare Sutton Place, an extension of York Avenue. In the summer of 1939 the foreground area will be filled in to carry the new East River Drive around the rim of Manhattan. It was proposed to carry same under the aforementioned thoroughfare by a tunnel but local objections forced the abandonment of this plan.

P. L. Sperr
title: East River - Shore and skyline of Manhattan between East 50th and 58th Streets - Williamsburg and Queensborough Bridges - [Campanile Apartments ; River House.]

text:
A general view of Midtown Manhattan and the Queensboro Bridge from one of the Grand Central-42nd Street skyscrapers. The Long Island City shoreline of the East River is separated from Manhattan by Welfare (Blackwells) Island.

1938-9

Alexander Alland

This photo is one of a series that appeared in the published volume "Portrait of N. Y." by Felix Reisenberg and Alex. Alland, IRGV.
title: General view - Midtown Manhattan.

folder: East River Drive & 24th Street (East), Manhattan, NY
text:
East River Drive (under construction) north from E. 25th Street, as photographed from atop the J. J. Little and Ives Co. Building at No. 425-35 E. 24th St. The shoreline is being extended to provide for same. The enclosed pier, (foot of 25th St.) an annex to the Municipal Lodging House will eventually be removed. The institutional structures are wings of Bellevue Hospital. Across the river is the Greenpoint--Long Island City shore and in the distance, the Queensboro Bridge can be discerned.

October 13, 1939
Views 1,2,3

P. L. Sperr

folder: East River Drive & 49th Street (East), Manhattan, NY
text:
East River Drive, north from East 49th Street, showing constructional details of this new marginal highway as it passes the River House and the Campanille, two modern apartment houses at the foot of East 51st Street. This necessitated an extensive concrete fill and an overpass providing access to their boat basin. Ripanian and wharfage rights were involved. Beyond is the Sutton Square area and the Queensboro Bridge.

July 23, 1939
No's. 1-2

P. L. Sperr

text:
East River shore and skyline--Manhattan: A view north from the foot of East 32nd Street, showing the river frontage prior to the constructional fill required for the new East River Drive. At the left is the N. Y. Steam Company. The massed chimneys of the Consolidated Edison Company plant are beyond. In the distance appears the Queensboro Bridge.

Alexander Alland

This photo is one of a series that appeared in the published volume "Portrait of N. Y." by Felix Reisenberg and Alex. Alland, IRGV.

1939
title: East River - Shore and skyline of Manhattan from East 32nd Street.

folder: East 53rd Street - Williamsburg and Queensborough Bridges - [Colonial Sand and Stone Company.], Manhattan, NY
text:
East River, Manhattan, Shore and Skyline, north from the dock at the foot of E. 53rd Street towards the Queensboro Bridge showing where a fill will be made to provide a support for the new East River Highway that will skirt the shore. Rock drills are seen slightly off of 54th Street and from their position indicate the width to be filled. View No. 2 is northwestward towards the mainland and shows the Colonial Sand and Stone Company occupying the frontage between 53rd and 54th Streets. At the latter point a new thoroughfare begins, (Sutton Place) and which continues to 59th Street where it changes its identity to the more prosaic York Ave.

February 9, 1939
Views 1 and 2 and 3

P. L. Sperr
title: East River - Shore and skyline of Manhattan from East 53rd Street - Williamsburg and Queensborough Bridges - [Colonial Sand and Stone Company.]

folder: Manhattan shore [from East 55th Street.], Manhattan, NY
text:
East River, Manhattan shore, north from East 55th Street, showing the waterfront area where the East River Drive was later constructed. On the right is Welfare Island seen under the Queensboro Bridge.

View 2 shows the area north from the bridge and dredging activities for the Drive. The Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research and the New York Hospital are on the right.

P. L. Sperr

View 1: February 9, 1939
View 2: July 28, 1939
title: East River - Manhattan shore [from East 55th Street.]

folder: East 58th Street - Williamsburg and Queensborough Bridges - [Riverview Terrace.], Manhattan, NY
text:
East River, Manhattan, Shore and Skyline, north from E. 58th Street and under the Queensboro Bridge (at 59th Street). Retaining wall at the left supports a small thoroughfare that extends between these two points. This is Riverview Terrace and has houses on its westerly side facing the river. At its northerly extremity is the New York Steam Company plant and which appears at the left margin. Beneath same is its coal receiving platform. Present plans call for the usage of the rocky area in the foreground during construction of the East River Drive. At this date the rock drilling for same is underway at 54th Street and shortly will proceed to this location.

February 9, 1939

P. L. Sperr
title: East River - Shore and skyline of Manhattan from East 58th Street - Williamsburg and Queensborough Bridges - [Riverview Terrace.]

text:
Queensboro Bridge, viewed northeastward from the foot of East 57th Street in Manhattan. In the foreground is the concrete roadway of the new East River Drive. Thru the midground and under the center span is Welfare Island with its new hospital buildings erected by the City with federal aid.

May 12, 1940

Gift of George Jiranek
Photostat Division
New York Public Library
